qas.question: What type of organism has been reported to have worked on infections?
Who noticed in a lab the antibacterial characteristics of mold?
What mold did Fleming notice had antibacterial properties?
What did Fleming initially think a good use would be for it?
What type of organism has been reported to have worked on penicillin?
Who noticed in a lab the development of chemists?
What mold did Fleming notice had chemotherapy?
What did Fleming initially think a good use for chemists would be?
What did Fleming use to treat a Petri dish?

context: The effects of some types of <a0_0><b4_0>mold<b4_0/><a0_0/> on infection had been noticed many times over the course of history (see: History of penicillin). In 1928, <a1_0><b5_0>Alexander Fleming<b5_0/><a1_0/> noticed the same effect in a Petri dish, where a number of disease-causing bacteria were killed by a fungus of the genus Penicillium. Fleming postulated that the effect is mediated by an antibacterial compound he named <a2_0><b6_0>penicillin<b6_0/><a2_0/>, and that its antibacterial properties could be exploited for <a3_0><b7_0>chemotherapy<b7_0/><a3_0/>. He initially characterized some of its biological properties, and attempted to use a <b8_0>crude preparation<b8_0/> to treat some infections, but he was unable to pursue its further development without the aid of trained chemists.
